items: Adjust the preacher bench to the appropriate height for your body.
Load the EZ barbell with the desired weight.
Sit on the preacher bench with your chest against the pad and your arms extended over the bench, holding the EZ barbell with an underhand grip.
Curl the barbell towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body and your wrists straight.
Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your biceps.
Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position, keeping your elbows and wrists in the same position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
When finished, carefully place the barbell back on the rack.
Targets the biceps brachii muscle, helping to increase arm strength and size
Allows for a greater range of motion compared to traditional bicep curls
Reduces strain on the wrists and forearms, making it a safer exercise for those with wrist or forearm injuries
Helps to isolate the biceps muscle, reducing the involvement of other muscles in the movement
Can be easily modified by adjusting the weight or grip on the barbell to increase or decrease the intensity of the exercise
